info.title: Management APIs (Multi-Tenancy)
info.description: Create and manage apps on-the-fly using our app management APIs

post.description: Creates an app in the account. It returns all the app related information.

skipSampleData.description: skips sample data if it is set true

appRegion.name: USA
appRegion.description: The USA region has serverslocated at Ohio.

get.description: Lists all the apps for an account.

parameters.name: searchKey
parameters.description: The "searchKey" query parameter allows filtering results based on either the ID or name properties of the apps.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The "perPage" property specifies the total number of records to be fetched in a single request. It determines the maximum number of items returned per page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The "page" property is utilized for navigating through the available pages of results. It indicates the specific page of results that is being retrieved or accessed.

appRegion.name: USA
appRegion.description: The USA region has serverslocated at Ohio.

delete.description: Schedule a specific app for deletion.

post.description: Retrieves usage data for multi-tenant apps.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The parent appId to which the subscription is linked.

usePreviousBillingCycle.description:
Indicates whether the usage from the previous billing cycle should be retrieved.

If set to false, the usage for the current cycle will be fetched.

If set to true, the usage from the previous cycle will be fetched.

data.message: Your usage request has been accepted and is being processed for . You will receive an email with the details at <emailID>@example.com

post.description: Enables or disables the extension for an app.

enabled.description: Array of extension IDs that has to be enabled.

disabled.description: Array of extension IDs that has to be disabled.

extention_id1.message: The extension extension_id1 has been enabled successfully.

extention_id2.message: The extension extension_id2 has been enabled successfully.

extention_id3.message: The extension extension_id1 has been enabled successfully.

post.description: Add Tenant

name.description: Specifies the name of the customer.

email.description: Specifies the email address of the customer, this will be the account identifier

password.description: For the purpose of accessing the CometChat account, a password in plain text format is required.

contactNumber.description: This represents the user's contact number information.

role.description: This indicates the role associated with the created account, such as developer, product manager, business owner, and so on.

appName.description: This defines the name of the application within CometChat.

appRegion.description: This refers to the selected region for the app. Users should select a region that is geographically close to their customer base for optimal performance.

industry.description: This pertains to the specific domain that the app is associated with.

technology.description: This refers to a single-string representation of the primary technology or framework utilized by the customer, examples of which may include 'ReactJS', 'Angular', 'Vue', 'Android', 'iOS', and so on.

CategoryType.description: Type of entries in the list

entity.description: Entity type in which moderation will be performed.

operand.description: Type of message content to moderate (e.g., text, image, video, custom).

operator.description: Operation to be performed for condition evaluation (e.g., contains, equals).

category.description: Type of entries for evaluation, either 'word' or 'pattern'.

isKeywordReferencePresent.description: Indicates if the value contains a reference to a keyword list.

isMediaPresent.description: Indicates if the incoming message contains media content.

value.description: Actual value for the condition, or reference ID if isKeywordReferencePresent is true, or a formula if isMediaPresent is true.

entity.description: Type of entity for group filter

operand.description: Field to apply the filter on for 'group'

type.description: Type of the filter, specifying sender or receiver

id.description: Unique identifier for the moderation rule.

name.description: Descriptive name for the moderation rule.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the rule is active.

description.description: Detailed explanation of the rule's purpose.
description.example: AI-powered video moderation to detect unsafe content.

action.description: Actions to be taken when a violation is detected.

conditions.description: List of conditions that must be met for the rule to trigger.

file.description: CSV file containing the keywords or regex patterns for the list.

name.description: Descriptive name for the pattern list.

description.description: Detailed explanation of the pattern list's purpose.

skipSenderMetadata.description: Excludes sender's metadata from the message object in the push payload

skipReceiverMetadata.description: Excludes receiver's metadata from the message object in the push payload

skipMessageMetadata.description: Excludes the message metadata from the message object in the push payload

trimMessageText.description: Trims the message text from the message object in the push payload to ensure the payload size does not exceed 4KB; exceeding this limit may prevent notifications from being delivered.

perPage.name: perPage
perPage.description: Number of apps to be fetched in a request. The default value is 25 and the maximum value is 1000.

searchKey.name: searchKey
searchKey.description: Searches for given keyword in apps list (either App name or App ID)

appIdVCB.name: appId
appIdVCB.description: App ID in which the builder has to be added.

perPage--extensions.name: perPage
perPage--extensions.description: Number of extensions to be fetched in a request. The default value is 25 and the maximum value is 1000.

X-Webhook-Version.name: X-Webhook-Version
X-Webhook-Version.description: The "X-Webhook-Version" header is an optional integer property.When this header is omitted from the request, the system defaults to the legacy webhook, ensuring backward compatibility and seamless operation.Conversely, setting the value of this header to "2" indicates the preference for the new webhook implementation.

requiredonBehalfOf.name: requiredonBehalfOf
requiredonBehalfOf.description: UID of the user on whose behalf the action is performed.

onBehalfOf.name: onBehalfOf
onBehalfOf.description: UID of the user on whose behalf the action is performed.

appId.name: appId
appId.description: AppID in which the extension has to be enabled/disabled
